caption: Figure 1: Riverswim experiment results
description: The figure shows the experimental results of the proposed algorithms (RRL-MNL, ORRL-MNL, UCRL-MNL+) and the existing state-of-the-art algorithm (UCRL-MNL) on a variant of the RiverSwim environment.  Subfigure (a) and (b) display the episodic returns for different state and horizon sizes. Subfigure (c) compares the runtime of the algorithms for 1000 episodes.  The results demonstrate that the proposed algorithms outperform UCRL-MNL in terms of both episodic return and computational efficiency.  ORRL-MNL and UCRL-MNL+ converge faster to optimal performance than RRL-MNL and UCRL-MNL.

caption: Figure 1: Riverswim experiment results
description: The figure shows the experimental results of the Riverswim environment.  Subfigures (a) and (b) illustrate episodic returns for different numbers of states (S=4, H=12 and S=8, H=24) and episodes, comparing the performance of RRL-MNL, ORRL-MNL, UCRL-MNL, and UCRL-MNL+.  Subfigure (c) compares the runtime of these algorithms for 1000 episodes.  The results demonstrate that the proposed algorithms (RRL-MNL, ORRL-MNL, and UCRL-MNL+) significantly outperform UCRL-MNL in terms of both episodic return and runtime.
